subject: Leadership
title: Transparent Communication
description: A short lesson to help you apply Transparent Communication.

hook.text: A startup hides financial struggles from employees. When layoffs hit, the team feels blindsided. Trust is shattered.

buildup.text: Transparency means sharing information openly, even when it's uncomfortable. It builds trust, alignment, and ownership.

discovery.text: Buffer shares salaries, revenue, and equity formulas publicly. Result: extreme trust and nearly zero internal politics.

twist.text: Full transparency isn't always wise. Balance openness with discretion. Share the why, even if you can't share all.

climax.text: Default to open. Share context behind decisions, financials where possible, and explain reasoning, not just the ruling.

punchline.text: People don't need all the answers. They need to trust you're not hiding them.

quiz.question: Why is transparency important in leadership communication?
options: It builds trust, alignment, and ownership
It removes the need for hierarchy
